oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: From Folk, to Hillbilly, to Country - What Next? - various interviews - Part 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Excerpt from "From Folk, to Hillbilly, to Country - What Next?" thesis for Austin Peay college by Mary Biggs, includes interviews with Jimmy C. Newman, Rufus Thibodeaux and Murray Nash.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Jimmy C. Newman talks -- Mary Biggs introduces Rufus Thibodeaux -- Thibodeaux talks about his career -- Murray Nash talks about Thibodeaux style of fiddle playing -- Nash tells a story about Thibodeaux -- Biggs talks -- Nash talks about leaving Acuff-Rose, becoming a solo producer, and eventually signing with London Records -- Nash talks about the end of his production career and transitioning to distribution -- Biggs talks about working for Murray Nash -- Nash talks about Hank William's career and death -- Nash talks about Fred Rose -- Nash tells a great story about Hank Williams and Paul Cohen -- Biggs and Nash talk about Tex Ritter and Gene Autry (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Newman, Jimmy C.; Thibodeaux, Rufus, 1934-; Nash, Murray;
